intro: Coffea viburnoides, commonly known as the African coffee tree, is a flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical Africa and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, white flowers. The plant produces red, fleshy berries that contain seeds used for coffee production. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique botanical features, it is of interest to both botanists and coffee enthusiasts.
